translation.title: Thirty Discourses On How Giving Helps to Become Womb-Born, Etc.

previous.name: Ten Discourses On How Giving Helps to Become Egg-Born

segments.en: Linked Discourses 29
1. Dragons
21–50. Thirty Discourses On How Giving Helps to Become Womb-Born, Etc.
At Sāvatthī.

segments.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho so bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Seated to one side, that mendicant said to the Buddha:

segments.pli: “ko nu kho, bhante, hetu, ko paccayo, yena midhekacco kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā jalābujānaṃ nāgānaṃ … pe …
segments.en: “Sir, what is the cause, what is the reason why someone, when their body breaks up, after death, is reborn in the company of the womb-born dragons …
moisture-born dragons …
spontaneously-born dragons?”

segments.pli: “Idha, bhikkhu, ekacco kāyena dvayakārī hoti, vācāya dvayakārī, manasā dvayakārī.
segments.en: “Mendicant, it’s when someone does both kinds of deeds by body, speech, and mind.
And they’ve heard:
‘The spontaneously-born dragons are long-lived, beautiful, and very happy.’
They think:

segments.pli: ‘aho vatāhaṃ kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā opapātikānaṃ nāgānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjeyyan’ti.
segments.en: ‘If only, when my body breaks up, after death, I would be reborn in the company of the spontaneously-born dragons!’
They give food …
drink …
a lamp.

segments.pli: So kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā opapātikānaṃ nāgānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjati.
segments.en: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of the spontaneously-born dragons.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ kho, bhikkhu, hetu, ayaṃ paccayo, yena midhekacco kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā opapātikānaṃ nāgānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjatī”ti.
segments.en: This is the cause, this is the reason why someone, when their body breaks up, after death, is reborn in the company of the spontaneously-born dragons.”
(Each set of ten discourses of this series should be treated in the same way.)

segments.pli: Evaṃ catūsu yonīsu cattālīsaṃ veyyākaraṇā honti.
Purimehi pana dasahi suttantehi saha honti paṇṇāsasuttantāti.)

segments.en: The Linked Discourses on dragons are complete.

suttaplex.blurb: One becomes a womb born, moisture born, or spontaneously born dragon due to ambivalent deeds in a past life, the appropriate aspiration, and giving various gifts
